column5: Great report, looks like a fun time up there and some fish caught to make it even better.  Thanks
Well see Ron its good thing i got the flue or i would have been the one being picked on lol what can you say about Ron other then stand up guy and a great guy to pick on lol
Hey fellas, great times.  Waynes a lucky frig to have a place on one of the most scenic lakes.  When the fish finally do co-operate there the catching can be great too.  Nice dooods.
I keep tellin yah Drew...the train goes right by @ noon everyday...step off it one time and we'll find them together!

Left my place at midnight on Thursday to drive up and meet Wayne at his place. After some transfering of loads and some wrenching on a trailer hitch we hooked my trailer up to his truck and headed north to meet up with Ron and his friends in North Bay at the Hortons. After some coffee, tea and a big gulp of sour milk, we were off to Temagami.  Once in town, we stopped at the local tackle store to get the latest scoop on the fishing and ice conditions. I bought a book on the Chapleau Crown Game Preserve, which has some pretty interesting history on the area as well as Missinaibi.  We drove onto the ice and made our way to Waynes cottage (nice spot bud!) He never did mention the near vertical climb form the water to the cottage, I dubbed it the "new" Chilcoot trail.    After we got all the gear in and unpacking, it was time to go fish! Wait, no we had to make some lunch, at least Ron did..... for all of us! He's gonna make someone a fine wife some day, at least it takes the heat off you, huh Emil? Thanks just the same Ron, those wraps were great, the soup topped it all off.    We were soon on our way, out on the big lake.    Its not easy taking a picture while youre driving a snowmobile!  Gentlemen....start your jigging!!!    Here is Wayne with one of his fish, I think this is the one that will be in his belly tonight...    Here is Ron and Keith working a couple of holes.    Here is an end of the day shot, beautiful sky up there...    We had a fish fry courtesy of Ron and some nice Simcoe perch fillets. Here he is giving me the gears about how a plumber would cook the fish...    Here is the meal Wayne and I had on Sunday night, we needed two plates those T-bones were so big!!!    Here is another nice laker caught on Sunday.    My lakers were all caught in about 30' of water on white Exude tube jigs with a Bad Boyz type jig inserted into it. Missed a few fish but it was a great time all around. Wayne, you are a very gracious host and I would like to thank you again for an awesome long weekend. Ron, it was nice to meet you and your crew, great bunch and I look forward to doing it again!

Well glad to see you had a good time. i was so upset when i woke up with the flue bug and could not make it. Well next year i'm living in a bubble the week before the trip no flue or cold for this guy next year. Will have you and Wayne down this year for a day/weekend of salmon/trout fishing on the lake.
Geez, that looks like a great time.  And Wayne actually has a fish in his hands     Okay, who gave it to him  Great report.  Thanks for sharing that.  Joey

Holy crap!!! Wayne actually caught a fish on Temagami!!! What is this world coming to???  It sounds like y'all had a blast! These are the things memories are made of!  Good on ya Wayne for hosting the event!!!
I was thinkin the same thing Dawg and Joey.Who gave Wayne a fish to hold? Looks like a good time for all. Joe

Lloyd "she" was great!   Sorry you couldn't make it for sure...you missed a riot. Next Year bud..next year!  Dano...nice optical illusion on that stair case shot. Not that steep bud ! LOL  Did I say we had a riot. My full post will be up soon.  Great lot of guys...would recommend fishing with any one of them. Dan, Ron, his nephew Jon and Lloyd's buddy Keith. Now Lloyd...well even though he didn't make it..a great guy as well.  As for the "who's fish" Bull....  Wayne
EXCELLENT
One word comes to mind...PHOTOSHOP!  WTG guys...sounds like a blast....great report
Nice fish that last laker looks real nice, way to put them on the fish Wayne.
Now that you mention it Roy... Waynes hands do look a little too big and the fish a little too small...
what Wayne caught a fish, ice fishing.......sure...lol looks like a great time guys
Sounds like a blast, good friends, good food and good fishing,what more could you ask for.   Thank you for sharing
Well done boys, looks like a perfect weekend
Nice stuff Lad's  Looks like you guys had a riot    Bear

Geez, what a fantastic weekend. Looks like you guys had lots of fun for sure. I've had the pleasure of meeting Keith. And Ron of course. Congrats guys.  Dano. Am I the only one that caught the side message in the above quote?  Ron sure is one heck of a cook. But why does he always imitate a plumber when he's cooking???  This past weekend.    One of the weekends that I fished with him.    I say we should pitch in and buy Ron a belt....
I'm just scared that he was scratchin his arse and I ate what he was serving !! LOL
:w00t:  :w00t:  :w00t:  Too funny Wayne....
lol! Nice fish.
Now I know how Lloyd got the flu....
DanC, that is some funny stuff!!! Keith may be joining me at Anglers Kingdom this spring.  Wayne, just when I was putting it all behind me.....

Oh sure, pick on that Ron guy! lol  Had a great time Dano.  And for everyone else, Wayne has a guest book that everyone fills out, great idea for you cottage owners. Well in Wayne's book, I signed it and made a small blurb... "Wayne caught a fish! Wayne caught a fish!" Well he did better than I did but can guarantee we all had the same amount of fun and giggles.
Great pictures and report, always like to see other people on ice. Isn`t crack illegal up there? Yes a belt or suspenders!
Looks like a super trip for all of you.  I love those lakers. One of my favourite fish. Beautiful markings. I really should give them more attention.
Grown men and Fruitloops.At least your lunch wraps looked tasty.Thanks fo the Pics Dano.MTP
Dang Mike...first you beat on my ketchup on my taters and now I can't get a sugar fix in the morning.... LOL
